Fiskheroes uses several file types for heropacks, different file types can have vastly different syntax and uses.
JS JS or JavaScript is probably the most common language you will be using in fiskheroes. JS files are used for data and renderer files. You can find more about the language with
title: File Types

content: Getting started with the Plume theme.
description: Getting started with the Plume theme.
title: Getting Started

content:
JS Variables Within heropacks, we utilize vars, a keyword that automatically detects the data type you provide to it
General Basics 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 // The general basics to know before starting are the following: var integer = 4; // Whole numbers var double = 4.122345534543354; // higher precision var float = 4.749353432; // less precision, but more better memory accuracy var bool = true; // Accepts false or true, is seen as 0 or 1 in binary var char = 'a'; // A single character var string = "apple"; // A collection of chars Advanced Data Types 1 2 3 4 5 // For more advanced topics, you can use the following: var nullVar = null; // The default state or when you want to return nothing # CHANGE var byte = 0; // # figure out wording var vec2 = (0, 1); // A two-dimensional plane. X & Y axis # VERIFY var vec3 = (0, 4, 2); // A three-dimensional plane. X, Y, Z axis # VERIFY
title: JS Variables
